channel.title: Easy Data Science with R and Python
channel.description: Using R and Python to tackle Data Science Problems one at a time. R and Python are the titans of Data Science. The Statistical Computing environement provided by R and the general purpose nature coupled with easily readable syntax of Python make them a formiddable duo. I have been wanting to explore these two languages in the data science doomain and this is how I would like to share my knowledge with the world.

item.title: Decision Tree Classification of Diabetes among the Pima Indian Community in R using mlr
item.dc:creator: Asel Mendis
item.description: In my last post I conducted EDA on the Pima Indians dataset to get it ready for a suite of Machine Learning techniques. My second post will explore just that. Taking one step at a time, my incoming posts will include one Machine Learning technique showing an indepth (as indepth as I can get) look at how to conduct each technique. Lets start with Decision Trees!

item.title: Diabetes Among The Pima Indians: An Exploratory Analysis
item.dc:creator: Asel Mendis
item.description: In this post we will explore the Pima Indian dataset from the UCI repository. This post will aim to showcase different ways of thinking of your data. Most novices to data science would rush into data preprocessing and not explore the data properly. The data cleaning stage can be subjective at times and here I offer my own view and opinons on this dataset
